answers.answer: Hi there.The numbness of the left small and ring fingers can be partly explained by the degenerations since these can cause some form of compression in origins of the ulnar nerve (which is the nervous innervation of the said fingers) and the weakness in the legs can also be partly explained by the degenerations.  However, the lightheadedness can be very hard to pin on the C5-C7 problem.  Systemic causes can cause this such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, low hemoglobin, or diabetes mellitus.  I suggest you have this evaluated by your doctors and discuss the possibilities I mentioned.Regards and God bless.

question: does degenaration of c5 c6 c7 cause you to have numbness in left pinky and ring fingers,weakness in legs, and lightheadness like you are going to pass out
title: degenaration of c5 c6 c7
